item.title: Using macOS' built-in vnc server from X11
item.description: Why I wanted an easy way to control my macbookpro from my desktop setup. What I found was a lot of proprietary options and a couple of open sourced ones that were okay, but always lacking some little thing that would annoy the hell out of me. Since I’m a cheap bastard and love open source I opted for the latter with modifications. Most vnc options were extremely slow, so I “vnced” my keyboard and mouse only (x2vnc), and connected the macbookpro to my monitor input.
